name: Fraudulent verification of an applicant as a person with a disability; penalty
text: §291-51.4  Fraudulent verification of an applicant as a person with a disability; penalty.  A physician or advanced practice registered nurse who fraudulently verifies that an applicant is a person with a disability to enable the person to represent to the issuing agency that the person is qualified to obtain a removable windshield placard, temporary removable windshield placard, or special license plates shall be guilty of a petty misdemeanor.  Each fraudulent verification shall constitute a separate offense. [L 2001, c 297, pt of §1; am L 2014, c 45, §6]
